item.title: [DISTRELEC-5516] Empty search query result
item.description:

1. Click on search box with empty query
2. Search box changes color and text also changes and blinks at the same time, without leaving the page. (something like in the screenshot)

Text:
EN: Please enter a search term
DE: Bitte geben Sie einen Suchbegriff ein
FR: N'oubliez pas votre clef de recherche. Merci.
(the rest of the languages will come soon)

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Hi Daniela,
What do you think about this? Please review.
BR, Rafael

Hi Rafael

It's an idea coming from Laura and we've looked at this together. I think it's a very good idea, as we've got quite a substantial amount of empty searches, which end up on the zero result page.

Please test after the next deployment
Thanks!

item.title: [DISTRELEC-5509] Test DE // B2B customer, Add Shipping Address during the check-out
item.description:
Normal B2B Customer (distrelec.testing+pusteblume@gmail.com password: distrelec)

Add New delivery adress

ends up with an error
item.summary: Test DE // B2B customer, Add Shipping Address during the check-out

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Please have a look, thx.

Hallo Evangelos

When I try to add new delivery address to the b2b user, the SAP acknoweledge the request with fault code.

I have attached the request and response xml file (addingNewDeliveryAddress.txt).

Could you please take a look on it?.

Hello Urs,
COuld you please check that out?

Hello Ligia

Could you check why we get the error when we try to create an additional ship to address?

Request:
<n0:CreateAddressRequest xmlns:n0="http://www.distrelec.com/sap">
<salesOrganization>7350</salesOrganization>
<customerId>1241501</customerId>
<address>
<billingAddress></billingAddress>
<shippingAddress>X</shippingAddress>
<companyName1>Logistik Zenter</companyName1>
<companyName2></companyName2>
<companyName3></companyName3>
<title></title>
<firstName>Mike</firstName>
<lastName>Thoma</lastName>
<additionalName></additionalName>
<streetName>Im Park</streetName>
<streetNumber>13</streetNumber>
<pobox></pobox>
<postalCode>11222</postalCode>
<town>Bremen</town>
<region>04</region>
<country>DE</country>
<phoneNumber>711100100</phoneNumber>
</address>
</n0:CreateAddressRequest>

Hi Urs,

It seems that the field INCO2 doesn't have any value assigned in the customizing table ZDGTT_DEF_CUST for VKORG = 7350 and KTOKD = 0002. Please check and fill accordingly.
I send you also a separate mail with print screen.

Best Regards,
Ligia

Hello Surendra
There was an issue on SAP site. This is now fixed.
Test was successful new ship to address "DHL" created.
fixed.
please specify the fix version. Can I test this now?
Just updated.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-5508] Test DE // Key account customer orders with different Billing address; Error in SAP and in Order history
item.description:
distrelec.testing+hasi@gmail.com

scenario: key account checks out with a different Billing Address
order is created
in order history and in SAP come the previous Billing Address.
item.summary: Test DE // Key account customer orders with different Billing address; Error in SAP and in Order history

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Please have a look, thx
If you need assistance please contact francesco.

Hello Urs,
Please check that. We need to make sure we read data from the historic tables. Ligia should be aware of that.

Hallo Evangelos,

The user has various billing address and user selects one of them during the check-out process. Then the order has been created based on the selected address.

But when the user get into the order-history page, SAP does not give the right billing address.

Could you please check it out?

Hello Surendra
The issue is that the order is already created with the wrong billing address in SAP therefore it is also wrong in the order history.
If I try the same directly in SAP with the interface it is working fine.

Could you send me the request which you send to SAP that we can check on our site?

Hi Urs,

Please take a look at the attachement (billingAddressRequest.xml).

Hello Surendra
It seems we have an issue in the request. The billing address "Test" in this case has the ID 1241045 not 1241532 as the customer ID. Therefore the sales order is created wrong and the order history does not shown the right billing address.

The problem is fixed.
There was a bug during the order creation, the payment address of the customer was used instead of the one choosed in the checkout process.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-5488] DE - Voucher calculation
item.description:
Issue
The calculation does not look nice in the checkout if a voucher is added.

Requirement

  1. The Vouchers with order-discounts should be shown in the following format: "- 0.00"
    That means with 2 chars after the decimal comma and instead of a "point" a "comma" should be used as separator. Between the minus sign and the numbers a space should be added.
  2. The add/delete button should be aligned in correlation to the payment icons and the button-text should be centered.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
FE work done.

Please assign to BE to correct the remaining issues:

  • Format of the voucher value.
  • Error when the voucher is valid

Thanks!

Demands :

    to insert inside distrelec.ch, de, at htaccess the relevant rules to redirect the old family to the new onces

  • Thank you to update the status of the implementation in the comment below.

comments.comment:
The ticket has been solved with the final solution.
At the moment this will only be available with the next deploy (v3.0.m29) on HP Quality sytem.
After the tests i will make this change available also for production.

Here some details:

  • 32K family view url configured for redirection
  • this type of redirect is only in place for googlebot UserAgent, not for normal customer navigation

Great news Francesco, thank you !

(just for reminder, what is the reason of "only for google bot UserAgent" ?)

item.title: [DISTRELEC-5440] Wrong replacement products
item.description:
Item 11095473 is defined as alternative item of 2157 different products.
Also for 11056417 "Galaxy S4".

Could you please check why this is the case?

In the IF01 of yesterday there was 11056417 (incl. a replacement)
11056417;776095;1056417;776095;KR;14;NDG;11095473;B_M;20140922;99991231;1000;PC;;ZTRA;700160;20140906000000

Today this column is missing and we keep the old status.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Hello Florian,
This is again a Webshop issue. SAP returns a different article code than the one that the webshop sends and finally results in an error in the Webshop. This needs to be handled on the webshop side with a proper message since Alternative products cannot be handled at the moment
Could you please check?
As discussed...

A fix has been done and new files have been exported.
Please verify.

I have made a reimport of the product data. Now it looks fine and we just have 105 products that have a replacement defined by SAP and overall 1530 products that have a replacement defined. So it seems that SAP does not know 1425 products!

item.title: [DISTRELEC-5413] EOL products still have stock in FF
item.description:
Many products which are indicated as EOL in the FF export file still seems to have stock - according to the figures in the export (1 or 2 vs. 0, which would be "no stock").

According to the logic, this cannot be, as with stock they would not be EOL. So either the EOL or the stock information is transferred wrongly to FF.

The stock indicators serve as the main rule in the recommendation engine to display only available products - so if we have wrong figures there, we also display wrong products. Without the correct status (0), we cannot steer this. And this is why we need to have correct figures also with EOL products.
item.summary: EOL products still have stock in FF

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Had a quick chat with David and we looked at 776095. Its a "Streckenartikel" - in case this helps to look into this.

The problem is, that the article has stock at the external supplier. The query is not considering today the status of the product during the stock calculation.
Florian checks now if we actually should display them with a 0 stock. I think this would be the case.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-5384] EOL products in Manufacturer pages

comments.comment: Could you please remove the EOL products from the manufacturer result list?

Do you agree Nando?
Yes... but I think the screenshot does not show the first list. It looks like it was named with the email address deliberately. I don't think that there is an issue with this, or is there?

Hi surendra

Thx.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-3723] CC-Payment-Interface // No error-msg
item.description: If you enter no credentials on the Creditcard-payment-form, there is no error-msg displayed directly on the template. This occurs on all countries, for chrome and firefox. IE has not been tested yet.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: please specify which credentials you have entered badly
es spielt keine rolle welche credentials, das verhalten bleibt gleich.
I updated the description, the old one was misleading. Basicly the problem is, if you leave a field in the payment template form empty, there is no error-msg displayed. see attached screenshot.

Können wie dies nun selber machen?
Brauchen wir ein Handover?

• Everything within the EvoPayments iframe is in a distinct template that needs to be sent to EvoPayments for deployment
  • They have a Q and a P environment on their end so everything can be tested
  • With that, the EvoPayments front end is independent form the rest of the webshop
  • Such error messages have not been implemented on that template. Dominic could answer whether the capabilities of EvoPayments allow for such error messages. There are some limitations on their end.
  • Independently of this, yes, a hand-over makes sense. Whom should become the responsible for this at Distrelec?

Dominic,
are error messages as described above by Rafael possible with EvoPayments?

if you leave a field empty or do not fill it out correctly (i.e. too short cc number), the field gets a red border and the mouse cursor is placed in this field. but it would also be possible for DeuCS and for EVO to show an error message below the field.

we should use the same design that we use on the /register forms (red triangle and error text in red). an error message above the form (as in the attached screenshot) would also be possible, but we should keep the design similar to the existing register form.

estimate 4h frontend work for each payment terminal. and translations of the error messages would be required.

To be implemented the following way:

  • yes, same design of the messages should be as close as possible to that of hybris forms
  • do only the field level message, as the "global" message outside the iframe would not be possible, and inside it is very close to the input fields, so field level is enough
  • both EVO and Dibs
  • One flaw that the highlighting of missing input has today: (at least in EVO) only the first field with missing/wrong data is highlighted. If at all possible, all fields with missing data should be highlighted at the same time.

Florian,
please assign as per the priority.
Can be used as a hand-over task of EvoPayments to your FE engineers.
Estimation of FE work: 1d

Waiting for the upload of the template to EVO for the final test.
It should be done during the day

Hello Rafael,
you can test now on test.distrelec.de/ch
Thanks,
Ruben

item.title: [DISTRELEC-3516] Improve performance of AJAX calls
item.description:
A lot of ajax requests are sent to PageControllers that extend AbstractPageController. Hence, all model attribute from the AbstractPageController are calculated and loaded as well, which in most cases is not necessary.

Possible solution: Move the ajax calls to separate controllers which just extend from the AbstractController.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Adrian,
what will be the impact of this, is FE also involved?
Prioritization based on impact analysis... please assign to Florian.

Performance gain for all the AJAX calls can be achieved by refactoring the controllers (BE work only).
It's hard to estimate the improvement: maybe 10-30%. (I keep this issue as MINOR)
Since AJAX calls are sent asynchronously the user is not "actively" waiting.

Info for the developer: Define a breakpoint at AbstractPageController.getMetaLists() and you will see that this method is unnecessarily called during AJAX calls.

A method annotated with @ModelAttribute is called before every excecution of a @RequestMapping annotated method. Note the word every in the sentence before.The @ModelAttribute annotated methods get called irrespective of whether or not the handler method or JSP uses the data.
In the AbstractPageController we haved over 50 methods which are annotated with @ModelAttribute. So for every AJAX Call these methods are called for nothing.

To fix this problem i see two possible solutions:

1: As Adrian mentioned above we can put the ajax calls into separate controllers which would extend directly from the AbstractController.
2: We can put all the global attributes into one method (for example addGlobalAttributesToModel) and call this method from everywhere we need those attributes. This would have the advantage that we don't have to implement separat ajax controllers and we have the possibility to decide for each request if we want to add the global attributes to the model or not.

Moved global @ModelAttributes into one single method due to performance optimation. We do not need all global attributes in json or redirect calls. Add the method addGlobalModelAttributes to the calls where you need the attributes.
